hanzi-su-wiki:
礎

Значения

Основа, фундамент

Мнемоника

Справа — растения 林, продираясь через которые надо выворачивать 疋 ноги в значении «терновник, боль». Каменный 石 фундамент выдерживает вес всего дома, как бы испытывая максимальную боль от его тяжести.

Варианты

础
purpleculture_pinyin:
chǔ
foundation; base
Фонд; основание
rtega_mnemonic:
礎礎RS
础础		foundation stone, cornerstone, plinth
  • stone 石 in the middle of the woods 楚 on which a building is built
  • ⓢ stone 石 from which everything comes forward 出
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 础)
Pictophonetic: 楚 indicates the sound; 石 (stone) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 石 [ shí ] stone, rock, mineral
    • 楚 [ chǔ ] clear, distinct; pain, suffering; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: Features like stones and woods are the foundation of a happy zoo.
heisig_constituent: cornerstone, stone, rock, grove, tree, wood, zoo, critters, tree2, wood2
heisig_story: This character depicts a cornerstone as a stone set at the end of a wildlife preserve (the "zoo in the grove").
myStory:
камень который прикатили с помощью животных и хлыста 楚 (дерево для головы животного, скотины)

楚楚 - neat
koohiiStory1: Features like stones and groves of trees are the cornerstones of a happy zoo.
koohiiStory2: A zoo which is still under construction is already full of animals. At the moment, only the cornerstone has been set in place. To temporarily keep the animals from escaping, a closely-packed grove of small trees is planted around the stone. (Note that this zoo needs some serious mending.).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There’s a stone, a tree, another tree, and a coat rack. That stone and two trees will make the perfect foundation for a house to put that coat rack in! This stone is flat and heavy and both of the trees are flexible and durable.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine making a foundation with the stone and the two trees so you’ll have a place for your coat rack. Feel the wood grain and cold stone against your skin as you move them around to form the foundation.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After you finish the foundation, the only step that's left is to wash the entire thing with soap (そ).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine getting on your hands and knees, rubbing a bar of soap all over the foundation you built. The soap gets into all the nooks and crannies in the wood and stone. Now if a coat falls off the coat rack onto the floor, you just add water and poof! Clean!
Ru_Notes:
Сте́ла — каменная, мраморная, гранитная или деревянная плита (или столб) с высеченными на ней текстами или изображениями. Устанавливается в качестве погребального или памятного знака.
Не путать: 碑 (いしぶみ、ヒ камень с надписью, надгробие).
Фонетик: 楚 (いばら、しもと、ソ хлыст, прут; чистота, свежесть; горе, беда).
Ru_Words:
礎いしずえ
  • основа, фундамент, столп
    • warodai
    礎石そせき
  • опорный камень, опора, фундамент, основание, устои
    • warodai
    基礎きそ
  • основа, основание
    • 基礎付けるきそづける
  • класть в основу, обосновывать
  • строить, воздвигать, создавать
    • warodai
    定礎式ていそしき
  • церемония закладки [здания]
    • warodai
    基礎工事きそこうじ
  • работы по закладке фундамента
    • warodai
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 木 (дерево), 疋 (животные), 石 (камень)
Ru_trainchinese: chǔ: (графема) цоколь (колонны или статуи); основа, фундамент
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the stone (石) by the switch (楚) is the cornerstone
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To remove a massive stone which is blocking the exit you have to wedge it out from it's foundation.
humanum_full_description_en: From " Stone " to " Chu " sound. The original meaning is the stone under the pillar. "Shu Wen Xin Fu": "Foundation, 礩 Ye. From stone, Chu sound." Such as "Huainanzi. Shuo Lin: "Mountain clouds steam, column foundation moist; Poria digs, rabbit silk die." Gao You's note: "The foundation, the column is under the stone." "Book of Jin. "Siyi Biography": "The houses are all made of coral, glaze for walls, and water essence as pillars." Zhang Jiuling of the Tang Dynasty "Xie Ci Poems and Silk Clothes": "But the pillars are down. I feel the blue clouds.
humanum_short_description_en: From " stone " to " Chu " sound. The original meaning is the stone under the pillar.
humanum_full_description: 從「石」，「楚」聲。本義是柱下的石礅。《說文新附》：「礎，礩也。从石，楚聲。」如《淮南子．說林》：「山雲蒸，柱礎潤；茯苓掘，兔絲死。」高誘注：「礎，柱下石礩也。」《晉書．四夷列傳》：「屋宇皆以珊瑚為梲栭，琉璃為牆壁，水精為柱礎。」唐代張九齡〈謝賜詩及衣服絹狀〉：「但柱礎雖下。感致於青雲。」
humanum_short_description: 從「石」，「楚」聲。本義是柱下的石礅。

Chinese: Features like stones and woods are the foundation of a happy zoo.
koohii1: Features like stones and groves of trees are the cornerstones of a happy zoo.
koohii2: A zoo which is still under construction is already full of animals. At the moment, only the cornerstone has been set in place. To temporarily keep the animals from escaping, a closely-packed grove of small trees is planted around the stone. (Note that this zoo needs some serious mending.).

Lesson: 17 frameNoV4: 394 frameNoV6: 421 Strokes: 18 Jouyou Grade: JH JLPT: 1
基礎(きそ): foundation, basis

從「 石 」，「 楚 」聲。本義是柱下的石礅。《說文新附》：「礎，礩也。从石，楚聲。」如《淮南子．說林》：「山雲蒸，柱礎潤；茯苓掘，兔絲死。」高誘注：「礎，柱下石礩也。」《晉書．四夷列傳》：「屋宇皆以珊瑚為梲栭，琉璃為牆壁，水精為柱礎。」唐代張九齡〈謝賜詩及衣服絹狀〉：「但柱礎雖下。感致於青雲。」
From " Stone" to " Chu" sound. The original meaning is the stone under the pillar. "Shu Wen Xin Fu": "Foundation, 礩 Ye. From stone, Chu sound." Such as "Huainanzi. Shuo Lin: "Mountain clouds steam, column foundation moist; Poria digs, rabbit silk die." Gao You's note: "The foundation, the column is under the stone." "Book of Jin. "Siyi Biography": "The houses are all made of coral, glaze for walls, and water essence as pillars." Zhang Jiuling of the Tang Dynasty "Xie Ci Poems and Silk Clothes": "But the pillars are down. I feel the blue clouds.

Name meaning

chǔ
foundation stone, plinth
Radicals: 石, 木, 疋  (stone, tree, coat-rack)
Meaning Mnemonic
There’s a stone, a tree, another tree, and a coat rack. That stone and two trees will make the perfect foundation for a house to put that coat rack in! This stone is flat and heavy and both of the trees are flexible and durable.
Imagine making a foundation with the stone and the two trees so you’ll have a place for your coat rack. Feel the wood grain and cold stone against your skin as you move them around to form the foundation.
Reading Mnemonic
After you finish the foundation, the only step that's left is to wash the entire thing with soap (そ).
Imagine getting on your hands and knees, rubbing a bar of soap all over the foundation you built. The soap gets into all the nooks and crannies in the wood and stone. Now if a coat falls off the coat rack onto the floor, you just add water and poof! Clean!
